about_the_game:
Discover the darker side of Victorian London in this British point & click comedy adventure.

After a mysterious explosion over Victorian London, Cummerbund Bandersnatch (a likeable, if dim-witted twit) visits his uncle's laboratory and discovers an experimental new formula guaranteeing a "good time" for whoever drinks it. Seduced by the promises in his uncle's journal, Cummerbund decides that it is probably safe to drink and discovers his life will never be the same again.

What may seem like a curse at first, leads Bandersnatch on a thrilling, love-torn adventure through the back alleys of Old London Town as he uncovers a sinister plot involving a secret society, the royal family, copious amounts of dog hair and his uncle at the very centre.

Demo

Take a night-time stroll around the local park, take in a show at "Giuseppe Mitchell's Famous Travelling Louse Circus" or enjoy a fat-encrusted delight from Mrs Figgins' pie shop as you attempt to mix the antidote to your uncle's experimental formula. Just watch your back at the local barbers! The demo is the perfect introduction to the world of Cummerbund Bandersnatch with high-quality art, hilarious dialogue and a promise of what's yet to come.

An origin story

Back in 2020, we created a short adventure game in under two weeks, for a game jam competiton. In that time, we developed a fully-voiced point & click adventure called Hair of the Dog. We released it on various platforms and, since then, it has been enjoyed by over tens of thousands of players worldwide.

We parked the concept while we worked on developing our first commercial title, Lucy Dreaming, which has enjoyed awards and critical acclaim since its release in 2022. Now we're returning once again to the fog-smothered streets of London town to expand the world of Cummerbund Bandersnatch and his peculiar condition.
detailed_description:
Discover the darker side of Victorian London in this British point & click comedy adventure.

After a mysterious explosion over Victorian London, Cummerbund Bandersnatch (a likeable, if dim-witted twit) visits his uncle's laboratory and discovers an experimental new formula guaranteeing a "good time" for whoever drinks it. Seduced by the promises in his uncle's journal, Cummerbund decides that it is probably safe to drink and discovers his life will never be the same again.

What may seem like a curse at first, leads Bandersnatch on a thrilling, love-torn adventure through the back alleys of Old London Town as he uncovers a sinister plot involving a secret society, the royal family, copious amounts of dog hair and his uncle at the very centre.

Take a night-time stroll around the local park, take in a show at "Giuseppe Mitchell's Famous Travelling Louse Circus" or enjoy a fat-encrusted delight from Mrs Figgins' pie shop as you attempt to mix the antidote to your uncle's experimental formula. Just watch your back at the local barbers! The demo is the perfect introduction to the world of Cummerbund Bandersnatch with high-quality art, hilarious dialogue and a promise of what's yet to come.

An origin story

Back in 2020, we created a short adventure game in under two weeks, for a game jam competiton. In that time, we developed a fully-voiced point & click adventure called Hair of the Dog. We released it on various platforms and, since then, it has been enjoyed by over tens of thousands of players worldwide.

We parked the concept while we worked on developing our first commercial title, Lucy Dreaming, which has enjoyed awards and critical acclaim since its release in 2022. Now we're returning once again to the fog-smothered streets of London town to expand the world of Cummerbund Bandersnatch and his peculiar condition.
legal_notice: Heir of the Dog® is a registered trademark.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 12.04 (64 bit only)
  • Processor: 2 GHz Dual Core CPU
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Video card with at least 512MB Shared VRAM & openGL 2.0 support
  • Storage: 600 MB available space
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Ubuntu 14.04 (64 bit only)
  • Processor: 2.6 GHz Dual Core CPU
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Video card with at least 512MB Shared VRAM & openGL 2.0 support
  • Storage: 600 MB available space

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Mac OS 10.7
  • Memory: 2 MB RAM
  • Graphics: Video card with at least 512MB Shared VRAM & openGL 2.0 support
  • Storage: 600 MB available space
mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Mac OS 11
  • Memory: 2 MB RAM
  • Graphics: Video card with at least 512MB Shared VRAM & openGL 2.0 support
  • Storage: 600 MB available space

name: Heir of the Dog

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Windows XP
  • Processor: 2 GHz Dual Core CPU
  • Memory: 2 MB RAM
  • Storage: 600 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Any Windows-compatible sound card
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: 2.6 GHz Dual Core CPU
  • Memory: 2 MB RAM
  • Storage: 600 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Any Windows-compatible sound card

reviews:
“It’s a well crafted point and click adventure that looks and plays like a LucasArts classic. The pixel art and voice acting are excellent, the writing is great and the puzzles are inventive and make great use of your different forms. Highly recommended.”
Alpha Beta Gamer
short_description: A hilariously British point & click adventure. After drinking his uncle's secret formula, Cummerbund Bandersnatch undergoes a monstrous transformation. Solve puzzles, manipulate time and uncover the truth behind Victorian London's most secret society as you regain your humanity.
supported_languages:
English*, French, Italian, German, Spanish - Spain, Portuguese - Brazil
*languages with full audio support
